Overview

I served several roles in an agile-style IT/Marketing environment as Project Manager, Business Analyst, Product Owner, and UX Designer. I also handled multiple projects at a time, learning software and management skills as needed. I have worked on projects from constructing an Ebook using iBooks author as project manager, product owner, and data visualization team member, to building an out-ward facing undergraduate magazine for Georgia State University Honors College where I served as Project Lead, content writer, product owner, UX designer, and client consultant.

Edge Magazine

On the Edge Magazine project, I am team lead. Charged with building a peer-reviewed undergraduate magazine/journal hybrid for the web from the ground up, I work to create a searchable, readable outward facing interface featuring content that students, alumni, and anyone curious about Georgia State University would want to absorb.

  • Writing the training manual for undergraduate level peer editors
  • Writing content such as submissions page, about page, and mission statement
  • Using Wordpress to create a simple, searchable online magazine-style interface
  • Working with faculty to build digital profiles that show off exceptional student work
  • Creating article models
  • Ensuring copyright compliance
  • Organizing the website so it is searchable and simple for readers
  • Presenting project progress
  • Team time and task management

Immigration ATL

Working for History Professor Dr. Marni Davis, I am tasked with making visualizations of her data about people who immigrated into Atlanta from the mid 1800â€™s to today.

  • Grouping data to create narratives
  • Creating graphs, charts, and maps using Tableau
  • Gathering requirements from the client
  • Presenting visualizations to the client
  • Creating multiple prototypes of visualization
  • Organizing team status meetings

Tobacco Ebook

Co-team lead to create an Ebook for the Department of Public Health about the dangers of smoking as part of their multi-million dollar grant. I recreated visuals to make them copyright compliant, set the format and layout of the Ebook using iBooks Author, selected visuals, and edited text associated with figures and references.

  • Researched available Ebook authoring tools
  • Designed Ebook using iBooks Author
  • Organized an event to crowdsource team for cover art and title of the book
  • Gathering requirements from the client
  • Ensuring copyright compliance
  • Edited text, figures and references, ensuring application functioned accordingly (checked links, etc.)
  • Showcased application to client

American Lit Bits

As team lead on the American Lit Bits project, I worked with American Literature faculty member Dr. Brennan Collins to realize a series of short videos on historical literary figures. My team collected video of an interdisciplinary array of professors answering questions on these figures, and edited the video so that they could be used in a variety of ways in any humanities course.

  • Recruited faculty to sit for video shoots
  • Built a video studio, including equipment testing
  • Prepped and filmed faculty
  • Wrote scripted questions
  • Edited video (iMovie, Adobe Premier Pro)
  • Packaged videos for social media presence
  • Presented video packages to faculty to test their usefulness in a classroom, or online lecture

Atlanta Connected Learning

I serve on the board of a collective of university faculty from colleges and universities across the greater Atlanta area. Together, we hold public talks, maintain a website, and generate conversations over social media. We aim to keep interested parties in the know about what the colleges and universities in Atlanta are working on, and toward.

  • Film promotional videos of the speakers at meetups
  • Deliver several talks
  • Generate interest via social media
  • Participate in live Google Hangout events
  • Attend board planning meetings
  • Recruit speakers

Sexual Harassment Training Videos

Team lead in creating a series of Sexual Harassment training videos that were high quality, real-life mimicking situations featuring specific types of scenarios that are common in the university setting.

  • Wrote scripts for the videos using Celtx
  • Starred in two videos
  • Held casting calls to get real, age-appropriate actors
  • Actively recruited actors
  • Acted as Production Assistant during filming
  • Scouted locations
  • Edited videos using Adobe Premier Pro
  • Showcased videos to client

Tools Wiki

I masterminded a wiki where users could search for digital tools to help them with coursework and other projects. I was given a team to create this wiki which is written by students, for students, and can be updated and edited by students.

  • Led a team of 4
  • Created wireframes
  • Explored all available themes in sites.gsu.edu (wordpress)
  • Designed possible ways to make the wiki user AND editor friendly
  • Led usability testing
  • Researched digital tools
  • Built the first 50 entries
  • Created an organizational flow that could maintain additions of new tools
  • Presented the status to our directors

Digital Portfolio Workshop

As part of a larger project to make the faculty of Georgia State University more publically visible, I gave a series of workshops instructing faculty to create a digital portfolio for a number of purposes. I demonstrated several sites that could host a portfolio, both free and subscription, and I helped interested faculty start building on online presence that they control.

  • Employed sites like SquareSpace, WordPress, and strikingly to show a variety of portfolios
  • Explored several options for design of portfolios
  • Presented portfolio design options to a variety of skill levels
  • Instructed a variety of knowledge levels on online presence
  • Used a multiscreen display to show all examples at once and give a hands-on experience

Faculty Innovation Consultant

I meet with faculty, and listen to their research needs. If the faculty member wishes to do something pedagogically innovative, whether that be data visualization, 3D mapping, or something else, we decide whether to take the project on, and who to assign to the project.

  • Understand what the other Innovation Fellows do, and create teams
  • Consult with faculty
  • Make suggestions to the faculty member about avenues they could explore
  • Give initial directions to a faculty member regarding his or her next steps in the innovation process
  • Manage the time needed to complete tasks
  • Manage team time requirements via calendar, email, and making meetings
  • Hold team status meetings
  • Present regular project status to fellowship directors

Innovation Fellowship Accomplishments

During the first year of the Student Innovation Fellowship, we needed to prove that we were making strides helping faculty and university departments move forward technologically. I took the initiative to make a report of what each Fellow was working on and accomplishing to deliver a document to upper administration that clearly showed the worth of our new fellowship. My document was eventually made into a webpage, which led to funding for the next year.

  • Interviewed each Innovation Fellows individually
  • Composed a short paragraph of their experience based on the interview
  • Arranged all projects by team members and accomplishments
  • Created documentation showcasing accomplishments and learned skills
